questions.question: Which bone forms the posterior part of the hard palate?
questions.hint: This bone is located behind the maxilla in the roof of the mouth.

questions.question: The brachial artery divides into radial and ulnar arteries at the level of:
questions.hint: This division occurs near the top of the radius bone.

questions.question: Which cranial nerve is responsible for facial expression?
questions.hint: This is the facial nerve.

questions.question: The thoracic duct drains lymph into:
questions.hint: It drains into the venous system on the left side of the body.

questions.question: Which muscle is the primary flexor of the forearm?
questions.hint: This muscle lies deep to the biceps and is often called the 'workhorse' of elbow flexion.

questions.question: Normal resting heart rate in adults is:
questions.hint: This is the standard range taught in medical school.

questions.question: The pacemaker of the heart is:
questions.hint: This structure is located in the right atrium.

questions.question: Normal blood pressure in adults is:
questions.hint: This is considered the ideal blood pressure reading.

questions.question: The functional unit of the kidney is:
questions.hint: This structure contains both vascular and tubular components.

questions.question: Insulin is produced by which cells in the pancreas?
questions.hint: These cells are found in the islets of Langerhans and respond to glucose.

questions.question: Which enzyme is deficient in phenylketonuria?
questions.hint: This enzyme converts phenylalanine to tyrosine.

questions.question: The end product of purine metabolism is:
questions.hint: This compound can cause gout when elevated.

questions.question: Which vitamin is synthesized by gut bacteria?
questions.hint: This vitamin is important for blood clotting.

questions.question: The rate-limiting enzyme of glycolysis is:
questions.hint: This enzyme catalyzes the conversion of fructose-6-phosphate to fructose-1,6-bisphosphate.

questions.question: Which amino acid is converted to serotonin?
questions.hint: This amino acid is also a precursor to melatonin.

questions.question: Which type of necrosis is characteristic of myocardial infarction?
questions.hint: This type preserves tissue architecture initially.

questions.question: The most common type of lung cancer is:
questions.hint: This type is more common in non-smokers and women.

questions.question: Reed-Sternberg cells are characteristic of:
questions.hint: These are large, abnormal lymphocytes with multiple nuclei.

questions.question: Which marker is elevated in hepatocellular carcinoma?
questions.hint: This protein is normally produced during fetal development.

questions.question: The most common cause of acute pancreatitis is:
questions.hint: These small stones can block the pancreatic duct.

questions.question: Which drug is a beta-blocker?
questions.hint: This drug blocks beta-adrenergic receptors.

questions.question: The antidote for warfarin overdose is:
questions.hint: This vitamin is essential for clotting factor synthesis.

questions.question: Which antibiotic inhibits protein synthesis?
questions.hint: This aminoglycoside binds to the 30S ribosomal subunit.

questions.question: The mechanism of action of aspirin is:
questions.hint: Aspirin irreversibly acetylates both cyclooxygenase enzymes.

questions.question: Which drug is used to treat opioid overdose?
questions.hint: This is an opioid receptor antagonist.
